quarks.execution.mbeans

Interface JobMXBean

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EtiaoJobBean

    public interface JobMXBean
    Control interface for a job.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  JobMXBean.State
      Enumeration for the current status of the job.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String TYPE
      TYPE is used to identify this bean as a job bean when building the bean's ObjectName.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JobMXBean.State getCurrentState()
      Retrieves the current state of the job.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Returns the identifier of the job.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the job.
      JobMXBean.State getNextState()
      Retrieves the next execution state when the job makes a state transition.
      java.lang.String graphSnapshot()
      Takes a current snapshot of the running graph and returns it in JSON format.

    • Field Detail

      • TYPE

        static final java.lang.String TYPE
        TYPE is used to identify this bean as a job bean when building the bean's ObjectName. The value is "job"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

        Returns the name of the job.

      • getCurrentState

        Retrieves the current state of the job.
        Returns:
        the current state.

      • getNextState

        JobMXBean.State getNextState()
        Retrieves the next execution state when the job makes a state transition.
        Returns:
        the destination state while in a state transition.

      • graphSnapshot

        java.lang.String graphSnapshot()
        Takes a current snapshot of the running graph and returns it in JSON format.

        The graph snapshot JSON format

        The top-level object contains two properties:

        • vertices: Array of JSON objects representing the graph vertices.
        • edges: Array of JSON objects representing the graph edges (an edge joins two vertices).
        The vertex object contains the following properties:
        • id: Unique identifier within a graph's JSON representation.
        • instance: The oplet instance from the vertex.
        The edge object contains the following properties:
        • sourceId: The identifier of the source vertex.
        • sourceOutputPort: The identifier of the source oplet output port connected to the edge.
        • targetId: The identifier of the target vertex.
        • targetInputPort: The identifier of the target oplet input port connected to the edge.
        Returns:
        a JSON-formatted string representing the running graph.
